thread.title: Desiree Linden Wins Boston Marathon, First American Woman Since 1985

author: Sara Germano
title: Desiree Linden Wins Boston Marathon, First American Woman Since 1985
text:
In miserable cold and driving rain, Desiree Linden on Monday became the first American woman to win the Boston Marathon in 33 years, breaking the tape in an unofficial time of 2:39:54.
Linden, 34, of Rochester Hills, Mich. is the first U.S. woman to win the prestigious race since Lisa Larsen Weidenbach did so in 1985. Lindenâ€™s victory is her best result in a marathon since she was runner-up in Boston, by just two seconds, in 2011.
